frontmatter.title: BrainSquall - Web App
frontmatter.description: BrainSquall is a startup in Seattle area that provides app of combination of diagram, documentation and table, which allow users to gather, organize and share complex information.

frontmatter.title: Portfolio
frontmatter.description: You're seeing my portfolio now. Why is my portfolio is so smooth and fast? That's because I use GraphQL and host on Gatsby.

frontmatter.title: My Bookshelf
frontmatter.description: This is an app that allow you to create your own bookshelf. You can organize your books in three different bookshelves, "currently reading", "want to read", and "read".

frontmatter.title: Would you rather?
frontmatter.description: This is an app that users can answer and create new polls, and see results.

frontmatter.title: Project Miguel
frontmatter.description: Miguel, the hedgehog, project is written by HTML and pure CSS. Those little feet move once you open the page.

frontmatter.title: Brown and Cony
frontmatter.description: It's a very first that I made with pure CSS animation project written in HTML and pure CSS. I also enjoyed using hover effect.

frontmatter.title: How to work on a commit log in git.
frontmatter.description: This is a note how to work on a commit log.

frontmatter.title: 2D array diagonal difference - HackerRank
frontmatter.description: You are given a 2D array that both inner and outer arrays have the same length. Return the absolute difference between sums of matrix's two diagonals. I solved this with JavaScript.

frontmatter.title: How to query multiple markdown files in the same component in Gatsby
frontmatter.description: I explain how to query multiple markdown files in the same component in Gatsby.

frontmatter.title: How to add self-hosted fonts in Gatsby
frontmatter.description: I struggled to add self-hosted fonts to my Gatsby project. This is a note to show how I solved it..
